intro: Cracca caribaea var. glandulifera, commonly known as the Caribaea glandulifera, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have glandular dots, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
